Article Title: Can I enable/disable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) for my account?
Answer:
Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) is a popular feature that allows users to protect their data and provides an extra level of security for their accounts. While we don't have 2FA options available for student accounts, Schools Admins and Teachers can optionally turn 2FA on for their accounts.

When 2FA is enabled, every time you attempt to log in, you will also need to enter a one-time password that is automatically sent to your email. In so doing, you can ensure that no malicious entities can access your account with your email and password alone.

 

To Turn On 2FA

Teachers and School Admins can turn 2FA on for their accounts by:

  1. Logging in to their account
  2. Clicking the My Account menu link
  3. Selecting the Two-Factor Authentication option from the drop-down menu.



  4. Toggling the Email Authentication link to the on position (the circle will be on the right when on).


Once activated, you should get a confirmation pop-up letting you know that 2FA is now enabled.

 

To Turn Off 2FA

At any time, Teachers and School Admins can also turn off 2FA by following the reverse steps of the above.

  1. Log in to your account
  2. Click the My Account menu link
  3. Select the Two-Factor Authentication option from the drop-down menu.
  4. Toggling the Email Authentication link to the off position (the circle will be on the left when off).


Similarly to turning 2FA on, you should also receive a confirmation pop-up indicating 2FA is deactivated.

What if I get locked out of my account?

If you lose access to your email, this means you will also be unable to log in to your Zenva Schools account. Should this happen, please contact our support team at your earliest convenience so we can help you restore access.

Answer:

While we can't accommodate every course request, we are willing to investigate and consider adding any course from Zenva Academy to Zenva Schools.

 

In order to request a course from Zenva Academy to be added, we require three things:

  • You must thoroughly review the course on Zenva Academy first to be sure that you will use it in your classroom.
  • You must be part of a registered school on the Zenva Schools platform.
  • You must formally submit your request via our helpdesk.

Once we receive your request, we will evaluate the course for several factors and let you know if we will add the course or not. As mentioned, some courses we may not choose to add for various reasons, including appropriateness for the Zenva Schools platform or a course containing too much outdated content for a school setting.

Additionally, even in cases where we choose to add a course, we may choose to add it to our Additional Courses catalog instead - which means we will not create any form of curriculum mapping for that course.

Regardless, we are dedicated to providing teachers the tools they need, so we take all requests seriously and are more than happy to investigate any such course request.

Article Title: Types of User Accounts
Answer:
Each person with a Zenva Schools account has one of three user roles. These roles determine what capabilities the user has, and ensures only the required features are available to each role.

Below, we will outline these roles and what they can do.

 

School Admin

The School Admin is the primary manager of their school's Zenva Schools account. As such, the School Admin has full permissions for the site. They can do everything, including:

  • Editing school details
  • Adding students, teachers, and classrooms
  • Deleting or deactivating students and teachers
  • Archiving or deleting classrooms

Each school can have only one School Admin.

 

Teacher

Teachers can do many of the same things School Admins can, including:

  • Adding students and classrooms
  • Deactivating students
  • Archiving classrooms

Teachers, however, cannot add teachers, edit school details, or perform any permanent deletions for school account data (such as student accounts).

Each school can have multiple registered teachers.

 

Student

This account role lets the user access course content assigned to their classroom by the teacher. Students can watch the video lessons, access course files, read course notes, check their progress, and collect a course certificate upon completion.

Article Title: How can I use Single Sign-On on Zenva Schools?
Answer:
Zenva Schools offers the ability for users to use Single Sign-On (SSO) for Azure AD Microsoft accounts, Office 365 Microsoft accounts, and Google accounts. This article will briefly discuss how to set up your school and user accounts to use the SSO option.

Setting up Accounts for Single Sign-On

Before being able to use SSO, School Admins and/or Teachers must perform the following steps.

Enable Email Login

In order for SSO to work, the School Admin must ensure their School Settings have Email Login enabled. As Username Login is the default login mode, you'll likely have to change this. This article here discusses how to enable Email Login mode and important considerations when doing so: Changing from Username Login to Email Login

You can also review this article for further information on the difference between Username and Email Login.

Add Students with Appropriate Email Addresses

Due to the way Zenva Schools is set up, School Admins and/or Teachers will still need to manually add students to their School Students list before they can login with an SSO option. You can follow this article's instructions for further steps on how to add students to your school: How to Add School Students

Before adding students, however, keep in mind the following points:
  1. Before adding students, make sure to enable Email Login as described above. Failure to do so may result in incorrect account data that will not allow SSO to work.
  2. You must add the student with the SAME email they use for your preferred SSO option. This sign-in option works by searching our database for a matching email - so if the email doesn't exist, SSO won't work.
  3. Students will still have a separate password for Zenva Schools stored in the system. They can use this password to log in should something happen to the account they use for SSO. Likewise, though, this password should still be kept secure.
  4. Things such as password management will be passed onto the SSO account - we do not store non-Zenva Schools passwords in our system so cannot perform things on them such as password resets.

Logging in with Single Sign-On

Once the accounts are set up for SSO, users can log in by following the process below.

1. Head to login.zenva.com
2. On the sign in screen, select the correct Connect with: button that applies to your SSO option (Google for Google accounts, and Microsoft for Azure AD or Office 365 accounts).



3. After hitting the appropriate button, follow the log in prompts to sign-in to the correct account.

If the login is successful, the user will be able to access all things Zenva Schools from this point!

Article Title: Risk Review for Queensland Schools
Answer:
For the convenience of schools in Queensland, you can find a public version of our Risk Review assessment below in case such documentation is required for you. Other locales are free to use the information where relevant to your own submission processes for using Zenva Schools in the classroom.

Accounts

Does the service provider provide a unique generic username and password for each user, or is an email address required?

Zenva Schools requires an email address for Teacher and School Admin accounts, which can be optionally secured with Two-Factor Authentication.

For students, we offer both email login or username login depending on the school’s preference. We do not provide a unique, generic username (this must be supplied by the teacher/school), but the system is able to generate unique, secure passwords if the teacher so desires (teachers can also provide passwords as a matter of preference).

Are users provided with an email address generated by the service, or does the school provide a list of usernames to the service (a list of user generated usernames, e.g. MIS ID via a .csv file).

Zenva Schools does not provide email addresses (or usernames). The school must supply their own list of usernames or emails to use the service.

How are accounts created and what personal information is used?

Accounts are created by the School Admin user directly within the platform. Teacher account creation requires the teacher name and email address. Student accounts require the student name and schools can choose between a username or an email address for login.

Where is the data hosted?

All our data is hosted in Australia. We use different SOC 2 certified organisations for the hosting of our infrastructure in Sydney data centres that include Microsoft Azure, DigitalOcean and Zoho Pty Ltd.

Course environment

How are courses delivered?

Courses are delivered entirely online through the Zenva Schools platform.

Who creates the content?

Zenva creates all course content internally with our team of authors.

What are the elements of the courses?

Depending on course, Zenva Schools can include a selection of the following with each course:
  1. Video lessons
  2. Text lessons
  3. Text-based lesson summaries of video lessons
  4. In-browser coding exercises
  5. Quizzes
  6. Course Files, including items such as assets used in the course, presentation slides, and source code
  7. Downloadable course plans and unit plans for teachers

Where are the videos hosted?

Microsoft Azure Media Services.

What 3rd party software is needed for the range of courses?

Third party software will depend on the courses the teacher is interested in. For example, a Python course will require to have Python installed, or a Unity course will require to have Unity installed.

The minimum requirement is a web browser to access the platform, but most courses require a code editor such as Visual Studio Code. Our courses can be followed along with any code editor.

Training

If the environment is interactive and students are required to complete activities, please select all that apply.
 
• The service provides standardised testing: NO

• The teacher or user can create their own online learning activities and/or games.: NO

• Answers can include pre-defined response options (e.g., multiple choice, Likert scales etc.): YES

• Answers are numerical free text fields (e.g., 0-9): NO

• Answers are short response free text fields (e.g., typing, equations, units of measurement, spelling and vocabulary): NO

• Answers can include long response free text fields (e.g., sentences, paragraphs, essays etc.): NO

• Data analysis, analytics and/or reporting is generated: YES

• Data analytics and/or reporting can be sent to parents via the service.: NO

Article Title: Username Login vs. Email Login
Answer:
Here at Zenva Schools, we allow teachers to add students either via username (default option) or via email (depending on which is preferable for the school). This can be changed at any time via the School Settings page by the School Admin only. This setting affects all teachers and students within the school, and you can only have one or the other active at one time.


Differences Between the Login Modes

Before choosing which setting works best for your school, keep in mind the following differences between the two methods.


Username
Email
Logging in
Must log in with a unique username such their student number (i.e. student1234), and their password
Must log in with their email as the username (i.e. student1234@example.com) and their password
Email Notifications
CAN receive email notifications (password resets, certificates, etc). The student can thusly recover their own password if they forget it.
CANNOT receive email notifications (password resets, certificates, etc.). Issues related to forgotten passwords will need to be managed by teachers.
Single Sign-On (SSO)
CANNOT use SSO
CAN use SSO as described in this article: How can I use Single Sign-On on Zenva Schools?

Note that regardless of which method you choose, students will always be able to access all learning materials and features. This setting only affects login and how data is displayed and stored for you.

 

Changing Your Login Mode

As mentioned, School Admins can change the login mode for their students via the School Settings at any time (such if you want your school to use our Single Sign-On option). However, before doing so, there are a few separate things to consider when switching from one mode to the other. As such, you should choose from the following articles that suits your situation the best:

  2. Changing from Username Login to Email Login

Article Title: Changing from Email Login to Username Login
Answer:

Article Title: Tips for Starting a New School Year
Answer:
In this article, we're going to discuss some recommended steps to take before starting a new school year on the Zenva Schools platform. Each step here is entirely optional, but is designed to help you make the most of the platform and have an ideal transition from one school year to the next.

1. Explore the Latest Courses and Resources

We strive to keep up with both evolving industry standards and school curriculum changes. As such, we're constantly altering our available courses to suit teachers' needs - whether that's adding new courses or updating current courses with new resources (such as curriculum mapping).

Before starting the school year, we recommend checking out our main Course Library as well as our Additional Courses to evaluate the courses you'll want to use in the classroom.

2. Delete Old Teacher Accounts

New school years often mean changes in staffing. As such, School Admins will want to review the Teachers part of their school and remove any colleagues who will no longer be working with the Zenva Schools platform.

3. Remove Old Student Accounts

As we charge by the seat, you'll most likely want to free up seats for incoming students. So, now would be a good time to remove any students that will not be using the platform for this coming school year. Please note, though, that any reporting data you want to keep must be saved locally before removing the student. Deletion is a permanent process that will erase all student data.

If you would, instead, like to purchase additional seats, please don't hesitate to contact us over our help desk.

4. Review Your Classrooms

Along with updating your user lists, you may wish to review your classrooms. Some changes you might want to make could include:
  1. Renaming or updating classroom details
  2. Creating new classrooms
  3. Adding new courses to classrooms
  4. Archiving old classrooms
  5. Deleting old classrooms

5. Review Login Mode

At the start of the school year is the best time to review how your students are logging in to the Zenva Schools platform. We offer both username and email login. The Single Sign-On (SSO) feature though only works with email login.

If changing from username to email to take advantage of SSO, we recommend making these changes before the school year starts in earnest.

6. Add New Teachers

Similarly to one of the steps above, you'll want to make sure to add any new teachers at your school who will be using the Zenva Schools platform this new school year.

7. Import New Students

Once your classrooms are ready, you'll obviously want to add new students to the platform. You can add students one at a time or in bulk.

We recommend doing this only after reviewing your classrooms and login modes - as otherwise you may need to manually add students to classrooms or update their details.

Article Title: How to Remove School Teachers
Answer:
The School Admin can remove a teacher from their school. Teachers can also be deactivated or deleted.

See also

  • How to add school teachers
  • How to edit teacher details

Deactivate vs Delete

Deactivate means a teacher cannot access any Zenva Schools features. However, their name stays on the school list. The teacher can access content if the School Admin activates their account.

Delete is a permanent change. This feature removes the teacher's name and data from the platform entirely (not just your school) and blocks content access. 

 

Deactivating a teacher

There are two ways to deactivate a teacher.

When adding a new user, uncheck the Active userbox.

       

For teachers already on the school list:

  1. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.

  2. Click Teachers.


  1. Locate the teacher's name.

  2. Click Deactivate.


  1. Click OK in the confirmation pop-up window. Their Active status changes to no.

 

Deleting a teacher

To delete a teacher:

  1. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.
  2. Click Teachers.
  3. Locate the teacher's name.
  4. Click Delete.


  1. Click OK in the confirmation pop-up window.

Article Title: How to Add School Teachers
Answer:
For some schools, multiple teachers may want to use the Zenva Schools platform. Fortunately, the School Admin can add a new teacher to their school at any point. School Admins can also change the status of a teacher from active to not active (and vice versa) as needed.

See also

  • How to edit teacher details

However, Teachers cannot add new teachers themselves, edit details about the School, or permanently delete any form of data.

 

Adding a teacher

To add a new teacher, the School Admin should:

  2. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.
  3. Click Teachers on the drop-down menu.

To activate (or deactivate) a teacher:

  2. Click Teachers.
  3. Locate the teacher's name.

In order to do this, Teachers and School Admins can easily filter students by classroom by following the instructions below.

  1. Log in to your account.
  2. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.

Article Title: As a teacher, how can I provide students their login information?
Answer:
When it comes to providing students their login information, there are a few different ways depending on your school setup. We've covered two methods below that will help make life easier so you can get your students learning as quickly as possible.

Note, however, that if using our Single Sign-On option, students simply need to use their Azure AD, Office 365, or Google credentials to access the platform.

 

Access Cards

On Zenva Schools, you have the option to use printable access cards that provide the web address for log in, the student's username or email (depending on your school's login method), and their password. By providing your students with these cards, they'll be able to jump right in and start learning.

There are two ways to access and print these cards.

Before Starting:

  • Emails on the access cards won't show unless the students have a registered email attached to the account. If your school used Username login originally and switched to Email, students will need to be manually assigned email addresses.
  • Passwords set before May 20th, 2022 will not be visible. See this article for more details: Why can't I see my student's password?
  • If using Single Sign-On, accounts will have a Zenva Schools password attached to their account. They can use this password to log in in emergencies, but the assumption is all password management will be handled by their Microsoft or Google account. We are unable to display students passwords for those accounts, as they are stored securely with those respective platforms.

 

Print Cards for ALL Students

You can print the cards for all students added to your school by following the instructions below.

  1. Log in to your account.
  2. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.
  3. Click Students on the drop-down menu.


  1. Select the Print Access Cards button.


 

From here, you can print the cards and distribute them as needed!

 

Print Cards for Classroom Students Only

After creating classrooms and adding students to them, you may want to print cards for just the students in that classroom. You can do this via the steps below.

  1. Log in to your account.
  2. Click the Classrooms menu link.
  3. On the Classrooms page, locate a classroom.
  4. Locate the classroom and select the Print Acess Cards link.


Alternatively, if you'd like to see the list of students in the classroom first:

Click the Students link instead...

... and click the Print Access Cards button on the classroom's page.


 

Print a Cards for a Single Student

Should a student lose their access card, you can print a single card for that specific student. There are two ways to find a single student's card.

 

Print Card from School Students List

  1. Log in to your account.
  2. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.
  3. Click Students on the drop-down menu.
  4. Locate the student and select the Print Access Card link.


 

Print Card from Classroom Students List

  1. Log in to your account.
  2. Click the Classrooms menu link.
  3. On the Classrooms page, locate a classroom.
  4. Click the Students link to access the Classroom's students.
  5. Locate the student and select the Print Access Card link.


 

Email (Email Login, Non-SSO only)

If your school is set up for email login AND you're using valid email addresses, you can put the responsibility of account management to your student.

When creating students, you have the option to automatically email them their password, as described in this article: How to Add School Students

Additionally, at any time, students can use the Forgot Password reset flow to change their password in this scenario.

Thus, in this case you will simply need to make sure students understand which email address to use to login.

Article Title: How do students login for the first time?
Answer:
In order for your students to log in, Teachers or School Admins must first confirm that the student has been added to the school account.

Once the students are added to the school account, they can log in via the information below (depending on your school's login method). Before proceeding, you may want to familiarize yourself with the difference between Username and Email login, which is set by the School Admin in the School Settings: Username Login vs. Email Login. However, by default, be aware schools are set to Username Login.


All Login Methods

Regardless of the login method your school is using, every account will have their username or email available on the School Students page list, as well as their password.


You can provide these details manually or, by following this article, you can also easily print access cards to provide students with their login information: As a teacher, how can I provide students their login information? 

From there, students only need to head to login.zenva.com to login. Once students log in, they can then change the password to whatever it is they want from their My Account page.

 

Email Login - Non-SSO ONLY

This section applies only to Email Login when the school does not intend to use our Single Sign-On option.
  • If you chose to send the students automatic account set-up emails upon adding them, they each should have received an email with a link. By clicking this link, students can set their password, and then be able to log in per normal login flows. 
  • At any time, students can use the Forgot Password reset form to change the password. From there, they can log in as normal with that password.

Note: If students did not receive an automatic email per the first point, it could be that your school is blocking our emails. You will need to contact your IT department to have our emails whitelisted.


Email Login - SSO

If you intend to use our Single Sign-On option and everything is set up for it, students need only to follow the steps outlined in this article with their Azure AD, Office 365, or Google account credentials: How do I Log in to Zenva Schools?

Article Title: How to Bulk Import New Students
Answer:
This article shows Teachers and the School Admin how to add many students to the school in one step. Students can be added either via email or via username, which is controlled by the School Admin at the School Settings level. You can read more about the differences here: Username Login vs. Email Login

Note that if you intend to use our Single Sign-On option, your students should be added by email. Please see this article for more details on preparing your account to use SSO: How can I use Single Sign-On on Zenva Schools?

In order for students to use the platform, they'll need to be added to a classroom. You have two options where this is concerned when adding students: 

  • Add students to the school and classroom at the same time (see below)
  • Add students to the school now and assign them to a classroom later.

We also have an option to add one student at a time. That workflow is described in a different article.

See also 

  • How to add school students
  • How to remove school students

Before you start

In order to use the Import feature, you will need to create a spreadsheet with the necessary data either via Excel or Google Sheets. This document should have the following columns, depending on your method of login:

Username Login

  • Column 1: First name
  • Column 2: Last name
  • Column 3: Username (these should be at least 6 characters)
  • Column 4: Passwords (optional, must be at least 4 characters long)



Note: If you do not assign a password during this step, you will either need to manually assign passwords by editing Student Details or view their assigned password from the Students List in order for students to be able to log in.

 

Email Login

  • Column 1: First name
  • Column 2: Last name
  • Column 3: Email (Note that if using SSO, this should be the same email they use for their Google, Azure AD, or Office 365 account.
  • Column 4: Passwords (optional, must be at least 4 characters long)

 

Bulk Importing Students

To add many students to a school, a Teacher or the School Admin should:

  1. Log in to their account.
  2. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.
  3. Click Students on the drop-down menu.


  1. On the next page, click Import Students. The Import Students window displays.


  1. Go to your spreadsheet and copy the student data (exclude column headings).


  1. Return to the browser tab with the Import Students window.
  2. Paste the student data into the blank field. 
  3. Make sure the Separator is set to Auto.


  1. Leave the Active user box checked. (optional but recommended, see below)
  2. Leave the Send welcome email box checked. (Email Login ONLY; optional but recommended, see below)
  3. Assign a classroom. (optional, see below)
  4. Click Create Accounts.


 

Checking the data

If the information in the next window is correct and no errors are found, click Proceed. After you click Proceed, Zenva Schools displays a Success window and shows a list with new student data.

 

 

If the information is not correct, or the system found errors, click Start Over. You can then correct the data as needed and repeat the steps.

 

 

After adding the students, you can check out the following articles so your students can start logging in:

  • As a teacher, how can I provide students their login information?
  • How do students login for the first time?

 

Using the Active user box

The active status of a student determines whether they can continue to access the classroom and courses or not.

If you leave the box checked (default setting), the Active status is set to yes. That means the students can log in to their account and access classrooms and courses.

If you uncheck the box, the Active status is set to no. With this status, the students can log into their account but cannot access classrooms or courses. 

Teachers and the School Admin can edit a student's Active status:

  1. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.
  2. Click Students.
  3. Locate the student's name.
  4. Click Activate. Their Active status changes to yes.
  5. Click Deactivate to change the status to no. 

 

Sending a welcome email

When using email login, Zenva Schools can send an email notification to each new student with a valid email address. Some schools use fake student email accounts (a practice that Zenva Schools permits). In those situations, students do not receive any notifications from Zenva Schools.

If you leave the Send welcome box checked (default setting), Zenva Schools sends each new user a message with a prompt to update their password.

 

Assigning a classroom

The assign a classroom option lets you add students and assign them to one or more classrooms in the same step. You can assign students to a classroom later in a different step if you want. In this case, leave the Classroom(s) field blank.

To assign a classroom:

  1. Click the field next to Classroom(s). A menu displays.
  2. Click a classroom name.
  3. Repeat to select another classroom. (optional)
  4. Create a new classroom. (optional)

Note: If you create a new classroom here, click the refresh icon. That adds the new classroom name to the menu.

Article Title: How to Remove School Students
Answer:
Only the School Admin can delete students from their school. Teachers and the School Admin can deactivate students or remove them from a classroom.

See also 

  • How to add school students

Deactivate vs Delete

Deactivate means a student cannot access any Zenva Schools content or features. However, their name stays on the school list and the platform continues to save their progress data. The student can access content if a Teacher or the School Admin activates their account. A deactivated student does count towards the school's number of student licenses.

Delete is a permanent change. This feature removes all the student's data from the platform.  A deleted student does not count towards the school's number of student licenses. That means, if you delete a student, it frees us a license that you can use for different student.

 

Deactivating a single student

Teachers and the School Admin can deactivate a student. There are two methods listed below.

 

Deactivate When Adding a Student

When adding a new user, uncheck the Active userbox. This will create the student account, but prevent them from accessing any course content. You can activate the student at any time after this moment.

 

Deactivating Students from the Student List

For students already on the school list:

  1. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.
  2. Click Students, which will show the students list.


From here, you can either deactivate a single student or multiple students at the same time.

Single Student

  1. Locate the student's name.
  2. Click Deactivate.

  3. Click OK in the confirmation pop-up window. Their Active status changes to no.

Multiple Students

  1. Locate the students' names and select the checkmark next to their names.



  2. Next to the search bar, select the Deactivate button.

       

At any time, you can reverse this process using the corresponding Activate button to change the status to yes.

 

Deleting a student

To delete a student, the School Admin should:

  1. Hover the mouse on the Administration menu link.
  2. Click Students to show the students list. From here, the School Admin can delete either a single student or multiple students.

Single Student

  1. Locate the student's name.
  2. Click Delete.


  3. Click OK in the confirmation pop-up window. Remember that this is permanent and cannot be undone!

Multiple Students

  1. Locate the students' names and select the checkmark next to their names.



  2. Next to the search bar, select the Delete button.

Article Title: How do Teachers or School Admins track their own course progress?
Answer:
If you're a Teacher or School Admin taking courses ahead of or with your students, you may wish to track your own progress through the courses you're using. This can easily be done from the My PD page, which can be accessed from the Courses dropdown menu at the top.


Anytime you start a course from our Main Course Library or Additional Courses list the course will be saved to your My PD page, where you can easily continue where you left off!

Article Title: How to Reset Course Progress
Answer:
Like students, Zenva Schools tracks course progress for Teachers and Schools Admins using our courses for professional development. However, there may come a time when you want to reset the course progress for a course you've been looking through. This can easily be done by following the steps below!

However, before proceeding, please note the following:
  • Once done, this cannot be undone. All your course progress will be permanently lost.
  • Resetting course progress does not reset the course certificate. This will remain available, and we're afraid there's nothing we can do in this regard.
  • Only Teachers and School Admins can reset course progress for themselves. This feature is not available for students.

 Resetting Course Progress

1. Navigate to the course's homepage.

2. On the Lessons tab, hit the Reset Course Progress button.


 

3. Once hit, you will receive a pop-up asking you to confirm your choice. Simply hit ok.


 

After hitting ok, the entire course's lesson completion status will be set to incomplete!

Article Title: What are "Additional Courses" and how do I access them?
Answer:
What Additional Courses Are

On occasion, and by request, we may open up access to "Additional Courses" that are part of our sister developer training platform Zenva Academy. These courses work exactly like the regular Course Library on Zenva Schools, and can even be added to classrooms as normal. The main difference between our main Course Library and our Additional Courses is that Additional Courses do not come with any form of curriculum mapping.

However, these Additional Courses allow us to go into different topics not standard to most school curriculums - such as Godot, AR, and similar. In this way, teachers can have the opportunity to explore other topics as they might need for the classroom.

 

How to Access Additional Courses

Additional Courses can be found by all schools on the platform simply by going to the Courses top menu dropdown and selecting the Additional Courses menu item:



From here, you can select and read information about the courses just as you would with the Course Library!

Article Title: About Course Quizzes
Answer:
Some courses on Zenva School have quiz lessons. These multiple-choice knowledge checks give students a chance to test their understanding of the core principles in the course.

 

 

Taking a Quiz

Quizzes are integrated with the courses they're a part of, so to take a quiz, students only need to access the relevant lesson. Once the student fills out their answers, they just have to hit the Finish button to submit the quiz and see the results.

Students are free to retake quizzes as many times as they want (as formal assessments will be left at the discretion of the teacher(s)). To retake a quiz, students should refresh the lesson page.

 

Quiz Results

Results are made immediately available to both Students and Teachers once the student clicks Finish. For Students, the quiz result will be shown at the top of the quiz, with incorrect answers for questions highlighted in red and correct answers highlighted in green.

Teachers (and by association School Admins) can review quiz scores via the classroom report or via individual student reports.

Article Title: About Live Coding Lessons
Answer:
Live coding lessons are interactive lessons that help students practice new coding skills right in their browsers. With live coding lessons, students can write code, test their work, and see the results immediately.

Please note, however, that code written here is not saved. That being said, this means that by refreshing the page, students can return to the default code that's provided.

We have two types of live coding lessons: 

  • Client-side live coding (used in JavaScript, HTML, and Phaser courses)
  • Server-side live coding (used in Python, C++, and C#) 


In order for live coding lessons to work, you may need to ensure your school allows certain domains. You can find a list of those domains here.

Article Title: How to Access Certificates of Completion
Answer:
Whenever students complete 100% of an entire course, our system will automatically generate a Certificate of Completion to mark their achievement.

 

These certificates are made available in a PDF format so they can be saved, printed, added to resumes, or anything else.

 

 

This article will discuss how both Students and Teachers can access those certificates.

 

Accessing the Certificate for Students

To access their Certificate of Completion, the student should:

  1. Log in to their Zenva Schools account.
  2. Click the My Learning menu link.
  3. Locate the completed course and click the course image to access the course's homepage.


  1. Click View Certificate. 


 

Accessing the Certificate for Teachers and School Admins

As a Teacher or School Admin, you can also view Certificates of Completion for individual students by viewing their Individual Student Report. You can access these by following the instructions outlined in this article: How to Access Individual Student Reports

 

Note About Email Notifications

If a student has a valid, registered email on the site (i.e. isn't logging in via username), when they complete a course, Zenva Schools automatically sends the student an email notification. The message has a link to the certificate file as well.

Article Title: How to Manually Mark a Lesson as Complete
Answer:
Each Zenva Schools course tracks the user's progress and automatically marks a lesson complete once the user reaches the end. However, there may be instances where the user wants to manually mark a lesson as complete.

While this can be done, there are a few things to keep in mind:

  • By default, only School Admins and Teachers can manually mark lessons as completed for the courses they're taking for professional development.
  • Students cannot mark a lesson as complete manually UNLESS the School Admin turns on the option via the School Settings. Even in these cases, School Admins and Teachers cannot mark lessons as complete on the student's behalf - it must be marked as complete from the student's own account. 

Manually Marking a Lesson Complete

With the conditions above established, users should do the following in order to mark a lesson as complete manually.

  1. Open a course and go to the lesson you want to mark as complete.
  2. Go to the menu bar at the bottom of the video viewer.
  3. Click the Lesson completed toggle to the ON position.



  • The default setting is OFF.


  • After clicking the toggle, Zenva Schools places a checkmark next to the lesson name and moves the progress bar. 


 

Marking a Lesson Incomplete

Users can also mark a lesson as incomplete in case they want to reset their progress. Follow the steps below to do so.

  1. Go to the list of course lessons.
  2. Click a lesson you want to reset progress for.
  3. Go to the menu bar.
  4. Switch the Lesson completed toggle to the OFF position.

Note

If the user completes a course, marking a lesson as incomplete does not affect the completion certificate.

  • The Course files panel displays.

Article Title: How to Access Lesson Notes
Answer:

Lessons Notes are text-based summaries of the lesson or course's content. They summarize key points of the presentation (but do not provide a full transcript of everything the teacher says in the video). These can be used in a multitude of ways, from using it to supplement the course as they go along or as a mechanism to review everything.

It is also possible to download the Lesson Notes file. If you want to download these summaries, see: How to access course files

Note: New courses on the platform may require a month or two before lesson notes are available.

 

Opening the Lesson Notes panel

The Lesson Notes panel displays.

  • Click the Lesson Notes tab to hide the panel.

  • Click and drag the panel to increase or decrease the lesson notes screen.

Article Title: Changing Video Playback Settings
Answer:
Each course video comes with a set of playback controls in the bottom right corner of the video viewer. These controls will allow users to individually change aspects of how the video plays and customize the experience to suit their learning needs.

This article shows users the options available and how to adjust them.

Article Title: About Video Playback Problems
Answer:
Zenva Schools uses Azure Media Services for videos - a cloud-based server owned by Microsoft.

If you're experiencing video playback issues, try the troubleshooting tips below. However, if none of the items below solve your video playback problem, reach out to us so that we can investigate the issue.

 

General Troubleshooting Tips

  • Try again later. Frequently, video playback problems are temporary issues with our third-party provider and resolve on their own. This said, we do apologize for the inconvenience in those situations.
  • Click this link to see if Azure is experiencing an issue in your area. You will specifically be looking for Azure Media Services' status.
  • Check your internet download speed. The streaming speed in your area might be having issues.
  • Contact the IT manager of your school. Perhaps the local network firewall blocks videos from Zenva Schools. Ask the IT department to whitelist domains listed in this article: What domains does my school need to allow?
  • See if the same problem occurs with a different web browser (e.g. switch from Chrome to Opera or Firefox).
  • Clear the cache in your current browser.
  • Enable JavaScript for your browser.
  • Disable browser plugins/extensions to see if they interfere with video playback.
  • Try a different device (e.g. switch from a desktop to a phone) to see if it is a device problem.
  • Try using a different internet connection with a different ISP (e.g. use a VPN). Please note that even if your internet works fine for other websites, your ISP may block or throttle files on our site.

Article Title: How to Install Unity
Answer:
This article will cover both how to install Unity for the first time, and how to install new versions of Unity for pre-existing installations. Before installation you may wish to review Unity's system requirements.

 

First Time Installation Only - Unity Hub

If you're installing Unity for the first time, the first thing you'll need to do is install Unity Hub - which helps keep track of all your projects and Unity versions. The steps below will describe the process for installing Unity Hub. If you already have Unity Hub installed, feel free to skip to the next section.

1. Head to the main Unity website at https://unity.com/
2. Click on the big blue "Download Unity" button on the front page.



3. Download the version of Unity appropriate for your machine. In general, this should be auto detected and available via the big blue button. If it isn't, you can easily select the "Download other versions" button to find the version right for you.



4. Open up the installation file and follow the installation steps (which will simply have you accept the terms and pick a location to install Unity Hub).






Installing a Unity Version

Whether you're a first time installer or a previous user looking for a new version of Unity, the installation of Unity follows the same steps described below.

1. If you haven't done so already, open up Unity Hub.
2. From the left-hand menu, select the Installs tab.



3. On the Installs page, select the "Install Editor" button in the top-right.



4. The Install Unity Editor page should pop-up. From here, you should select which version of Unity you want to install and hit the "Install button". In general, we recommend installing the latest LTS.



5. The next step is to select the modules to install along with Unity. There are several options, including build supports for different platforms, language support, and so forth. You should select the modules most relevant to you, but note that you can install these later at anytime.

However, if this is your first time installing Unity, make sure to select Microsoft Visual Studio Community. This is the default IDE required to work with code in Unity. For previous users, you should see it mentioned as already installed.

Once you've selected everything, hit the Install button in the bottom right to start the installation process.



6. Wait for Unity to install. Note that because of the file size, this may take some time. Once installation has finished, though, you can start using your version of Unity!

Article Title: How to Install Phaser to Your Project
Answer:
In this article, we'll cover how to download and install Phaser to your HTML5 projects.

Downloading Phaser

1. Create a new folder to house your project. Then, inside that folder, create a folder titled "js" and an index.html file. You can also add assets or anything else you might need to your project directory.



    2. Head to the Phaser website at http://phaser.io/
    3. From the top menu, hit "Download" to head to the downloads page.



    4. On the downloads page, hit the "Download Phaser from GitHub" button to continue.



    5. Download the appropriate file. We highly recommend choosing min.js if you intend to make your game available on the internet. However, you can use the regular js option as well.



    6. Once downloaded, place your .js file into the js folder in your project.



    7. The last step is to include the library as part of your project. To do so, open your index.html file in the code editor of your choosing and add the following code to make your project recognize the Phaser library:

    1. <!doctype html>
    2. <html lang="en">
    3. <head>
    4.     <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    5.     <title>Phaser Project</title>
    6. </head>
    7. <body>
    8.     <script src="js/phaser.js"></script>
    9. </body>
    10. </html>


    Creating Your First Phaser File

    This section will briefly demonstrate how to create files for your Phaser project and include them in your project. This step is also good if you'd like to verify Phaser is installed correctly.

    1. In the js folder from the previous section. create a new .js file.
    2. In your index.html file, alter the code to include this new script:
    1. <!doctype html>
    2. <html lang="en">
    3. <head>
    4.     <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    5.     <title>Phaser Project</title>
    6. </head>
    7. <body>
    8.     <script src="js/phaser.js"></script>
    9.     <script src="js/game.js"></script>
    10. </body>
    11. </html>


    3. If this is the initial file of your game, there are three things that need to happen. We need to create a new scene, set the configuration of the game (height, width, etc), and create the new game while passing the configuration to it. The code below does all three, which you can add to your new .js file.
    1. // create a new scene
    2. let gameScene = new Phaser.Scene('Game');

    4. // set the configuration of the game
    5. let config = {
    6.   type: Phaser.AUTO, // Phaser will use WebGL if available, if not it will use Canvas
    7.   width: 640,
    8.   height: 360,
    9.   scene: gameScene
    10. };

    12. // create a new game, pass the configuration
    13. let game = new Phaser.Game(config);


    4. Verify the project works by opening index.html in any modern web browser. Upon opening, you should see a blank, black screen.

    You will also see that there is an indication in the Console window that Phaser is indeed working.

Answer:
In this article, we'll showcase how to install Visual Studio Code (VSC), a multi-language applicable code editor, for Windows. If you'd like to install VSC for Mac, see this article instead: How to Install Visual Studio Code for Mac

Installing VSC for Windows

1. Navigate to the VSC page at https://code.visualstudio.com/ and select the big blue download button that says "Download for Windows" (your OS should be automatically selected).




2. Once the download completes, open the installation wizard to start the installation process.

4. After installation completes, simply launch VSC to start using it!


About Extensions

In order to use VSC properly with any language, you will need to download that language's extension to access various support features. To access the extensions:

1. From the left-hand side menu, click the four stacked boxes to open the VSC Extensions page.



2. Use the search bar to locate a specific extension required for whatever language you want to develop with (Python, C++, HTML/CSS, etc.). Once you locate the extension, simply click on it to view more information about it.



3. On the Extension page, hit the Install button to install the extension.



Once the extension installs, you should be ready to start developing. Please note, though, that some extensions (like C++) may require further configurations.

Article Title: How to Install Python on Mac
Answer:

Download Python

2. Go to File > New File from the top menu to create a new file:

  1. print("Hello world")
